title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 8600.5 - Preapplication conference
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 8600.5 - Preapplication conference

State Regulations
(a) An
applicant who has filed a master application project information form may
request a preapplication conference at any time prior to submission of any
application forms. (b) The office, at its discretion, may convene representatives of interested State agencies to
confer with the applicant on an informal basis in order to clarify their
interest in the business undertaking, project or activity, to assist the
applicant in the permit application process, and to develop a coordinated
permit processing timetable. (c) The director of the office may invite State agencies not acting as interested

State agencies to participate in the preapplication conference. Such additional
agencies may be invited when they are involved in business promotion or
regulation (e.g., Department of Agriculture and Markets, Department of

Commerce, NYS Council on the Arts, Urban Development Corporation, etc.) and
their participation may inure to the benefit of all parties. (d) A preapplication conference shall in no
way bind any of the parties. (e) Nothing in this section shall preclude a prospective applicant from discussing
a proposed business undertaking, project or activity with the Office of

Business Permits and other agencies prior to submitting a master application
project information form. Such discussions are encouraged. Notes

8600.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
